newsitem.title: INDIA: India contracts for sale of 575,000T soymeal.
newsitem.headline: India contracts for sale of 575,000T soymeal.

text.p: Indian soymeal exporters have sold 575,000 tonnes of soymeal but offtake was limited due to a fall in demand in foreign markets, traders said on Tuesday.
They said soymeal yellow was quoted at $255 fas (free alongside ship) for November shipments compared to $292-293 in mid-September.
"Indian soymeal prices may further decrease due to weak domestic and international market," said Prakash Mutha, a senior official of the Soybean Processors Association of India (SOPA).
Mutha said soybean arrivals were expected to increase in the central Indian markets after limited arrivals during the past two days due to a Hindu festival.
Till last week traders had signed contracts for sale of 550,000 tonnes of soymeal.
On Tuesday new soybean of around 1,000 tonnes had arrived in the markets in the central state of Madhya Pradesh.
Traders said contracts were being signed for November, December and January shipments with main buyers from Singapore and Germany.
Soybean was quoted at around 9,600-10,150 rupees per tonne in the domestic markets.
"The prices of soybean, soymeal and soyoil may further decrease because availability of soybean will increase at the end of the week," said Prakash Vohra, a trader.
